He still has weeks to go before full recovery, but he‚Äôs on the right path & exceeding expectations. He‚Äôs a strong kid with a lot of determination. We‚Äôre so proud. And I‚Äôm confident he will be up & out before we know it! Enjoy the picture that John asked we share with everyone. https://t.co/xEw5lJTSmE

He was released from ICU last week & transferred to a brain & spinal clinic. He‚Äôs now progressing through physical, cognitive & speech rehabilitation. He‚Äôs at a great facility & responding to the treatment well.

Our family would like to thank everyone for the thoughts, prayers & kind notes that we have received over the last week. As we enter the 9th day since John‚Äôs cycling accident, I‚Äôm proud to say that he is doing remarkably well.

White House and U.S. Capitol tours have been suspended effective 3/13/20. The Capitol will remain closed to the public until 4/1, and the White House has not yet issued guidance on when public tours will resume. More information can be found here:

Effective 3/13/20, the offices of Rep. Tom Graves will be under a modified operating status due to the public health emergency. The D.C. staff will be teleworking during normal business hours until further notice. The Dalton and Rome offices will be closed to the public.

John's strength is returning and he's showing improved signs of responsiveness and beginning to ask questions. We are thankful for these positive developments as John continues with his recovery. Thank you for all of the well wishes and prayers. They are so appreciated.

Thank you for the outpouring of support and prayers these last few days. Sunday, John suffered severe head trauma and had multiple spots of bleeding on his brain. Thanks to his dedicated medical team, he's been responding extremely well to treatment and care.
He‚Äôs a strong boy and is showing signs of responsiveness. We appreciate the outpouring of support and continued prayers as John begins his recovery.

Yesterday morning our son, John, a member of Georgia Tech‚Äôs cycling team, was critically injured during the Calhoun Downtown Criterium and airlifted to a trauma unit. He remains in intensive care and is being cared for by a top-notch team of doctors and medical professionals.

The CFAA was enacted in 1986, when the launch of the first iPhone was still 20 years away, and only 10 percent of Americans owned personal computers. Times have changed, and our policies have failed to keep up. https://t.co/8Zqt9UI04n

That's why @RepJoshG & I teamed up on a bill to give authorized individuals & companies the tools to actively defend their networks. Right now, under the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act (CFAA), individuals are unable to take actions against hackers outside of their own networks.

In the last few years, #GA has experienced major cyberattacks, costing our state millions.

Every sector, from govt at all levels to small biz to Fortune 500 companies, faces data breaches & dangerous hacks. 

When it comes to cyber defense, the status quo is unacceptable.

We aren‚Äôt finished yet. We have more work to do before the year is over & I can think of no better capstone to my legislative career than to leave Congress in better shape for future #Congress.

When it comes to communicating, we recognize the importance of good, robust communication with the American people, too.

That‚Äôs why we recommended increasing opportunities for constituents to communicate with their Representatives and allowing for faster ways to connect.

Even during times of division we have to find a path forward. I have often said that the breakdown in civility & bipartisanship here in #DC is because of the breakdown in relationships. 

It‚Äôs important that we talk to each other & most importantly ‚Äì listen to one another.

We found ways to boost civility & bipartisanship in #congress, recommending bipartisan retreats & nonpartisan new Member orientation.

At times it felt like we were going against the grain to issue recommendations on this topic but I think that‚Äôs why this cmte's work is so impt.

Our first round of recommendations aimed to ‚Äúopen up‚Äù Congress. The work we do here in Washington is for our constituents & they should be able to easily access information about votes, bills & who is lobbying Congress.

What happens here should be just a click away.

The @ModernizeCmte is one of the most exciting things I've been a part of in #congress. Every rec we make aims to strengthen the House so that we can better serve all Americans.
